intro: Bromus tomentellus f. brachyathera, commonly known as the short-leaved silky brome, is a grass species characterized by its dense, tufted growth habit and hairy, silvery leaves. It is native to the western United States and is often found in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and produces spikelets that are tightly clustered along the stems. Its foliage is covered in fine, white hairs, giving it a distinctive silvery appearance. This subspecies is valued for its ornamental qualities and its ability to stabilize soil in arid environments.
